stories.text:
For years you have been able to buy a USB-A hub with lots of ports that provide data & power. For some reason though its impossible to find anything like that for USB-C. I was looking for a hub that has 4 USB-A ports & 4 USB-C ports with data & power for all and I cant find anything at all. The most I could find is 2 & 2, and usually with a bunch of other unnecessary ports.

This made me think: is there some technical limitations here? I feel like the demand should be there since it was there for USB-A, and USB-C has already been out and popularized for many years. The only reason I can think why such a product doesn't exist _at all_ is because of some technical limitation like power draw or something.
stories.title: Ask HN: Why are there no good USB-C hubs?
